faqs_subtitle: Everything you need to know about Sendora
faq_q1: What is Sendora and how does it work?
faq_a1: Sendora is a web-based DeFi toolkit for Ethereum that provides smart contract interaction, transaction broadcasting, and deployment tools. It works by connecting directly to Ethereum RPC endpoints, providing an intuitive interface for blockchain operations without requiring a backend database.
faq_a2: Yes, Sendora prioritizes security. We never store your private keys, all transactions are signed locally in your browser, and our smart contracts are open source. All operations connect directly to Ethereum nodes without intermediate servers.
faq_a3: Sendora supports Ethereum mainnet and popular Layer 2 solutions including Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, and Polygon. We also support testnets like Sepolia and Goerli for development and testing purposes.
faq_a4: Sendora offers three simple plans: Basic (0.15 ETH/year) includes Broadcast Transaction, Signthis, Deploy Contracts, and Callthis tools; Pro (0.75 ETH/year) includes all Basic features plus All tools access and priority support; Ultimate (0.5 ETH lifetime) includes everything with highest priority support.
faq_q5: Can I use Sendora with my existing wallet?
faq_a5: Yes! Sendora integrates seamlessly with popular wallets like MetaMask, WalletConnect, Coinbase Wallet, and Rainbow. Simply connect your preferred wallet and start using all features immediately.
faq_a6: We provide community support through Discord for all users. Pro users receive priority technical support, while Ultimate users get top priority support. All support is provided by our technical team during business hours.
faq_contact_text: Can't find the answer you're looking for? Join our community for support.
pricing_note: All prices are in ETH. Gas fees not included.
privacy_description: Learn how Sendora protects your privacy and handles your data when using our DeFi tools.
privacy_disclaimer: Note: This Privacy Policy is provided in both English and Chinese. In case of any discrepancies, the English version shall prevail.
privacy_section_1_content:
Sendora is designed with privacy in mind. We do not collect or store personal information, private keys, or wallet data. All interactions with our DeFi tools occur directly between your browser and blockchain networks through RPC connections. Any data processing happens locally on your device.

However, we do collect anonymous analytics data to improve our website and services through third-party providers:

**Google Analytics 4** - Website traffic analysis, user behavior patterns, and performance metrics

**Cloudflare Analytics** - Website performance, security monitoring, and traffic optimization

**OneDollarStats** - Additional website analytics and visitor insights

These services may collect data including:

- Browser type and version
- Device information and screen resolution
- Operating system and language preferences
- Geographic location (country/region level)
- Page views, session duration, and interaction patterns
- Referral sources and UTM tracking parameters

All collected data is anonymized and aggregated. We do not collect personally identifiable information or link analytics data to wallet addresses.
privacy_section_2_content:
We use the collected analytics data solely for:

**Website Improvement** - Understanding user experience and optimizing site performance

**Technical Optimization** - Identifying and resolving technical issues

**Feature Development** - Analyzing which tools are most useful to our community

**Security Monitoring** - Detecting and preventing malicious activities

We do NOT use this data for:

- Creating user profiles or tracking individual behavior
- Selling or sharing data with third parties for marketing
- Linking analytics data to wallet addresses or transactions
- Targeted advertising or commercial purposes
privacy_section_3_content: Your security is our top priority. All transactions are signed locally in your browser using your connected wallet. We never have access to your private keys or funds. Our smart contracts are open source and auditable. All connections to blockchain networks use secure HTTPS/WSS protocols.
privacy_section_4_content:
Sendora integrates with several third-party services, each with their own privacy policies:

**Analytics Providers:**

- Google Analytics 4: [Google Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy)
- Cloudflare: [Cloudflare Privacy Policy](https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/)
- OneDollarStats: [OneDollarStats Privacy Policy](https://onedollarstats.com/privacy)

**Wallet Providers:**

- MetaMask, WalletConnect, Coinbase Wallet, Rainbow, etc.

**Blockchain Infrastructure:**

- Various RPC endpoint providers

We recommend reviewing the privacy policies of these services to understand how they handle your data. Sendora does not control the data practices of these third-party providers.
privacy_section_5_content: Since we do not collect personal data, there is no stored information to access, modify, or delete. You maintain full control over your wallet and transaction data. You can disconnect your wallet at any time to stop using our services.
privacy_section_6_content:
If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please join our Discord community. We're committed to transparency and will respond to your inquiries promptly.

**Data Subject Rights:**

Since we only collect anonymous analytics data, there is no personal data to access, modify, or delete. You can opt out of analytics tracking using browser settings or privacy extensions.

**Cookie Management:**

You can control cookies through your browser settings. Disabling analytics cookies will not affect the functionality of our DeFi tools.
terms_description: Read our terms of service to understand your rights and responsibilities when using Sendora DeFi tools.
terms_disclaimer: Note: These Terms of Service are provided in both English and Chinese. In case of any discrepancies, the English version shall prevail.
terms_section_1_content: By accessing and using Sendora, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services. These terms constitute a legal agreement between you and Sendora.
terms_section_2_content: Sendora provides web-based DeFi tools for Ethereum blockchain interactions including smart contract deployment, transaction broadcasting, balance checking, and other blockchain utilities. Our services connect directly to blockchain networks without storing user data or funds.
terms_section_3_content: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your wallet and private keys. You must comply with all applicable laws and regulations. You acknowledge that blockchain transactions are irreversible and agree to verify all transaction details before confirmation.
terms_section_4_content: Sendora is provided 'as is' without warranties. We are not liable for any losses, damages, or issues arising from your use of our services. Cryptocurrency and DeFi activities involve significant risks, and you use our services at your own risk.
terms_section_5_content: Sendora's code is open source under applicable licenses. Our branding, trademarks, and proprietary content remain our intellectual property. You may not use our intellectual property without permission except as provided by open source licenses.
terms_section_6_content: We may terminate or suspend access to our services at any time without notice. You may stop using our services at any time by disconnecting your wallet. These terms remain in effect even after termination where applicable.
terms_section_7_content: These terms are governed by applicable international laws regarding blockchain and cryptocurrency services. Disputes will be resolved through appropriate legal channels in accordance with blockchain industry standards.
terms_section_8_content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service or need legal clarification, please contact our legal team. We're committed to maintaining clear and fair terms of service.
docs_description: Complete guide to using Sendora DeFi tools for Ethereum blockchain interactions.
docs_subtitle: Everything you need to know about using Sendora
docs_section_getting_started_content:
Welcome to Sendora! This guide will help you get started with our DeFi tools.

## Quick Start

To begin using Sendora, you'll need:

**A compatible wallet** - MetaMask, WalletConnect, Coinbase Wallet, or Rainbow
**ETH for gas fees** - Required for all blockchain transactions
**Basic understanding** - Familiarity with DeFi and smart contracts

## First Steps

1. Visit sendora.org and connect your wallet
2. Choose your preferred Ethereum network
3. Select the tool you want to use
4. Follow the on-screen instructions

## Safety Tips

- Always verify transaction details before confirming
- Start with small amounts on testnets
- Keep your private keys secure
- Double-check contract addresses
docs_section_features_content:
Sendora provides a comprehensive suite of DeFi tools for Ethereum interactions.

## Core Features

**DeFi Analytics & Calls** - Real-time monitoring and smart contract interaction tools
**Transaction Broadcasting** - Broadcast signed transactions across multiple networks
**Balance Insights** - Track token balances across all your wallets
**Smart Contract Deployment** - Deploy and verify contracts on multiple chains
**Token Multisender** - Send tokens to multiple addresses in one transaction

## Supported Networks

- Ethereum Mainnet
- Arbitrum
- Optimism
- Base
- Polygon
- Sepolia (testnet)
- Goerli (testnet)

## Key Benefits

- **No Registration Required** - Connect your wallet and start using immediately
- **Direct RPC Connection** - No intermediary servers or databases
- **Open Source** - Transparent and auditable smart contracts
- **Privacy Focused** - We never store your private keys or personal data
docs_section_smart_contracts_content:
Sendora makes smart contract interactions simple and secure.

## Callthis - Contract Function Calls

Execute any smart contract function with an intuitive interface:

1. Enter the contract address
2. Select the function you want to call
3. Provide required parameters
4. Review gas estimates
5. Confirm the transaction

## Signthis - Message Signing

Securely sign messages and data:

- **Personal Messages** - Sign arbitrary text messages
- **Typed Data** - Sign structured data following EIP-712
- **Contract Verification** - Prove ownership of addresses

## Deploy Contracts

Deploy smart contracts effortlessly:

```solidity
// Example contract deployment
contract MyContract {
    uint256 public value;
    
    constructor(uint256 _value) {
        value = _value;
    }
}
```

## Best Practices

- Always test on testnets first
- Verify contract source code
- Use appropriate gas limits
- Keep deployment keys secure
docs_section_broadcasting_content:
Broadcast pre-signed transactions across multiple blockchain networks.

## How It Works

Transaction broadcasting allows you to:

1. **Sign transactions offline** - Create signed transactions without broadcasting
2. **Store for later** - Save signed transactions for future execution
3. **Broadcast to multiple networks** - Send the same transaction to different chains
4. **Monitor status** - Track transaction confirmation across networks

## Supported Transaction Types

**Standard Transfers** - ETH and ERC-20 token transfers
**Contract Interactions** - Function calls to smart contracts
**Multi-signature** - Transactions requiring multiple signatures
**Batch Operations** - Multiple operations in a single transaction

## Broadcasting Process

1. Prepare your signed transaction data
2. Select target networks
3. Configure gas settings for each network
4. Review and broadcast
5. Monitor confirmation status

## Use Cases

- **Cross-chain operations** - Execute similar transactions on multiple chains
- **Delayed execution** - Sign now, broadcast later
- **Backup transactions** - Create fallback transactions
- **Gas optimization** - Wait for optimal gas prices
docs_section_balance_checking_content:
Track and analyze token balances across all your wallets and supported networks.

## Real-time Balance Tracking

Monitor your portfolio with live data:

**ETH Balances** - Native Ethereum balances across all networks
**ERC-20 Tokens** - All token balances in supported wallets
**NFTs** - ERC-721 and ERC-1155 token tracking
**DeFi Positions** - Balances in lending protocols, DEXs, and yield farms

## Multi-wallet Support

Connect and monitor multiple wallets:

1. Add wallet addresses to your watchlist
2. Automatically detect token holdings
3. View aggregated portfolio value
4. Export data for tax reporting

## Advanced Features

**Historical Data** - Track balance changes over time
**Price Integration** - Real-time USD values
**Custom Tokens** - Add unlisted tokens manually
**Alerts** - Notifications for balance changes

## Privacy & Security

- Balance data is fetched directly from blockchain
- No personal information stored
- View-only access to wallet data
- Secure RPC connections
docs_section_troubleshooting_content:
Common issues and solutions when using Sendora.

## Connection Issues

**Wallet not connecting?**
- Ensure your wallet extension is installed and unlocked
- Try refreshing the page
- Switch to a supported network
- Clear browser cache and cookies

**Transaction failing?**
- Check your ETH balance for gas fees
- Increase gas limit if needed
- Verify contract addresses
- Ensure sufficient token allowances

## Network Problems

**RPC errors?**
- Try switching to a different RPC endpoint
- Wait for network congestion to clear
- Use a VPN if regional restrictions apply

**Slow confirmations?**
- Increase gas price for faster processing
- Check network status on block explorers
- Be patient during high network usage

## Common Error Messages

`Insufficient funds` - Not enough ETH for gas fees
`Execution reverted` - Smart contract function failed
`Nonce too low` - Transaction nonce conflict
`Gas limit exceeded` - Transaction requires more gas

## Getting Help

If you need additional support:

- Join our Discord community
- Check our FAQ section
- Contact support via email
- Review transaction on block explorer
docs_section_api_reference_content:
Technical reference for developers integrating with Sendora.

## Smart Contract Addresses

Sendora smart contracts are deployed on multiple networks:

**Ethereum Mainnet**
```
Multisender: 0x1234...
Deployer: 0x5678...
```

**Arbitrum**
```
Multisender: 0xabcd...
Deployer: 0xefgh...
```

## RPC Endpoints

Recommended RPC endpoints for each network:

**Ethereum:** `https://eth.llamarpc.com`
**Arbitrum:** `https://arb1.arbitrum.io/rpc`
**Optimism:** `https://mainnet.optimism.io`
**Base:** `https://mainnet.base.org`
**Polygon:** `https://polygon-rpc.com`

## Integration Examples

### Web3.js Integration

```javascript
const Web3 = require('web3');
const web3 = new Web3('YOUR_RPC_URL');

// Connect to Sendora Multisender
const contract = new web3.eth.Contract(
  MULTISENDER_ABI,
  'CONTRACT_ADDRESS'
);
```

### Ethers.js Integration

```javascript
const { ethers } = require('ethers');
const provider = new ethers.providers.JsonRpcProvider('YOUR_RPC_URL');
const signer = provider.getSigner();

const contract = new ethers.Contract(
  'CONTRACT_ADDRESS',
  MULTISENDER_ABI,
  signer
);
```

## Rate Limits

- Public RPC endpoints may have rate limits
- Use your own RPC for production applications
- Implement proper error handling and retries

## Support

For developer support:
- Technical documentation on GitHub
- Developer Discord channel
- Code examples and tutorials
